dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So Alibaba's secondary listing in Shanghai is aiming for up to $13.1 billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So Alibaba's secondary listing in Shanghai is aiming for up to thirteen point one dollars billion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the worlds biggest IPO so far this year, Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba is set to raise up to $12.9 billion in a landmark public listing in Hong Kong, boosting the financial markets of a city gripped by political unrest and recession.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, which would make it the biggest IPO of 2019 so far, right? Beating Uber's debut earlier this year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, which would make it the biggest I P O of twenty nineteen so far, right? Beating Uber's debut earlier this year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It would also be the worlds biggest IPO so far in 2019: Alibabas Hong Kong listing exceeds Ubers $8.1 billion public debut in New York and AB InBevs $5 billion IPO of its Asia business in Hong Kong earlier this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And it's a discount of 2.9% compared to their New York share price, which seems to have driven huge demand—they closed their books early.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And it's a discount of two point nine percent compared to their New York share price, which seems to have driven huge demand-they closed their books early.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alibaba said that it would price shares at $HK176 ($22.50) each, a discount of 2.9% to its New York Stock Exchange closing price (eight Hong Kong shares will be worth one U.S.-listed share), Reuters confirmed on Wednesday. The price means that Alibaba is set to raise at least $11.3 billion, and up to $12.9 billion if a greenshoe option to list more shares is exercisedbut that looks likely since the skyrocketing demand for shares caused Alibaba to close its books earlier than expected, according to CNBC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, that greenshoe option could push it to that full $13.1 billion, which is just massive. And it'scheduled for November 27, I think?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, that greenshoe option could push it to that full thirteen point one dollars billion, which is just massive. And it'scheduled for November twenty seven, I think?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The price means that Alibaba is set to raise at least $11.3 billion, and up to $12.9 billion if a greenshoe option to list more shares is exercisedbut that looks likely since the skyrocketing demand for shares caused Alibaba to close its books earlier than expected, according to CNBC. Scheduled for November 26, the listing could swell Alibabas cash pile to around $44 billion, which would be more than any other internet company and double that of rival e-commerce giant Tencent, according to Bloomberg.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yep, end of this month. And get this—it'll bring Alibaba's total cash pile to around $45 billion, which is more than double what Tencent has on hand.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep, end of this month. And get this-it'll bring Alibaba's total cash pile to around forty five dollars billion, which is more than double what Tencent has on hand.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Scheduled for November 26, the listing could swell Alibabas cash pile to around $44 billion, which would be more than any other internet company and double that of rival e-commerce giant Tencent, according to Bloomberg.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, that's a serious war chest. But then Saudi Aramco's coming in December and might break Alibaba's all-time record from 2014, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, that's a serious war chest. But then Saudi Aramco's coming in December and might break Alibaba's all-time record from twenty fourteen, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alibabas listing will likely be eclipsed by Saudi Arabias state oil giant Saudi Aramco, going public on the Riyadh stock exchange in December, with its IPO set to raise up to $25.6 billionthat could break Alibabas existing record for the worlds largest IPO in history.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, up to $25.6 billion for Aramco, which would actually surpass Alibaba's own historic IPO. But still, this Shanghai listing is a huge deal for the city's markets.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, up to twenty five point six dollars billion for Aramco, which would actually surpass Alibaba's own historic I P O. But still, this Shanghai listing is a huge deal for the city's markets.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alibabas listing will help boost Hong Kongs financial markets, given that the city recently slid into recession for the first time in over a decade, following more than five months of anti-government protests.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Especially with everything going on there—the economic slowdown, political tensions... This could really help boost confidence locally.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Especially with everything going on there-the economic slowdown, political tensions... This could really help boost confidence locally.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alibabas listing will help boost Hong Kongs financial markets, given that the city recently slid into recession for the first time in over a decade, following more than five months of anti-government protests.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And with the trade war, China's pushing companies to list closer to home. Alibaba choosing Shanghai sets a pretty strong example for other Chinese unicorns.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And with the trade war, China's pushing companies to list closer to home. Alibaba choosing Shanghai sets a pretty strong example for other Chinese unicorns.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And with the ongoing U.S.-China trade war leading the Chinese government to call for companies to publicly list closer to home, Alibabas listing helps cement the Hong Kong Stock Exchange as one of this years largest venues for IPOsand that could set an example for other Chinese unicorns to opt for Hong Kong over the U.S. when they go public.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Plus, they'recently crushed it with Singles Day—$38 billion in sales? That's just mind-blowing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. Plus, they'recently crushed it with Singles Day-thirty eight dollars billion in sales? That's just mind-blowing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In its eleventh edition of Singles Day, the biggest shopping event in the world, Alibaba set a new sales record of $38.4 billion in gross merchandise volume during the 24-hour shopping bonanza.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: More than Black Friday, Cyber Monday, and Prime Day combined from last year. It's on another level entirely.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: More than Black Friday, Cyber Monday, and Prime Day combined from last year. It's on another level entirely.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To compare, Singles Day far outpaces other big e-commerce days in the U.S., with Alibabas haul more than double the amount sold on last years Black Friday, Cyber Monday and Amazon Prime Day combined.
